I think it‚Äôs silly for us to think it‚Äôs wrong to feel a little uncomfortable when associating with someone who struggles with mental illness. Anyone who acts different than we do will be hard for us to understand. I think the best course of action is not to guilt trip anyone by comparing it to racism or homophobia, but to encourage people to move past it on their own and teach others about how people with mental illnesses are no less a person than anyone else.

I hear you. It‚Äôs okay to be put off by mental illnesses. It‚Äôs natural. The important thing is treating the person with a mental illness as a person. Try to teach yourself not to stereotype them. Do your best to understand. It‚Äôs okay to feel uncomfortable around a person experiencing psychosis or the like. What‚Äôs important is to be kind and understanding, and to try to remind yourself that stereotypes are not accurate.
